Package com.bluegosling.concurrent

Classes that extend and enhance the API provided by the java.util.concurrent package.

See: Description

  • Interface Summary 
    Interface Description
    Awaitable
    An object that represents a future event.
    Cancellable
    Represents an activity that can be cancelled.
    FutureListener<T>
    A listener for the completion of a future.
    FutureVisitor<T>
    Interface for the visitor pattern with FluentFutures.
    ManagedBlockers.InterruptibleSupplier<T>
    Like a Supplier, except allowed to throw an InterruptedException.
    ManagedBlockers.TimedInterruptibleSupplier<T>
    Similar to ManagedBlockers.InterruptibleSupplier, but accepts a time limit argument and can throw a TimeoutException if the given time limit elapses before the result value is available.
    ManagedBlockers.TimedInterruptibleWait
    A function that waits up to a given limit for some event.
    Scheduled
    A specialization of Delayed that allows for more accurate comparisons between the time at which instances are scheduled.
  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    AbstractQueuedReferenceSynchronizer<S,R>
    Provides a framework for implementing blocking locks and related synchronizer that rely on FIFO wait queues.
    Duration
    Represents a duration of time that is backed by an integral length and a unit.
    FutureTuples  
    ManagedBlockers
    Numerous utility methods related to blocking using ForkJoinPool.ManagedBlockers.
    RateLimitedBlockingQueue<E>  
    RateLimiter  
    SimpleFutureVisitor<T>
    A simple visitor implementation that is suitable for sub-classing.
    SimpleFutureVisitor.Builder<T>
    A builder for constructing visitors from Consumers and Runnables.
    ThreadFactories
    Utility methods for creating thread factories.
  • Exception Summary 
    Exception Description
    DeadlockException
    An unchecked exception that is thrown when a lock acquisition is attempted that would result in deadlock.
    ReentranceException
    An exception indicating that a reentrant lock acquisition was attempted but is not unsupported.

Package com.bluegosling.concurrent Description

Classes that extend and enhance the API provided by the java.util.concurrent package. Of particular note:

FluentFuture

This interface is a Future that allows completion callbacks to be registered. This means code has the flexibility of either doing things asynchronously with callbacks or synchronously by blocking for the future to complete. It also provides numerous other new methods to greatly improve the ease of use of futures. This interface is accompanied by several classes with useful static methods to further expand the types of tasks you can perform using futures.

SerializingExecutor

An executor that maintains multiple queues, each identified by a "key". Tasks associated with the same key run sequentially. Tasks associated different keys can run concurrently. There are two implementations provided. One that wraps a given executor and enforces the parallelism and sequencing independent of the underlying execution mechanism, and another that is a novel thread pool implementation.

HierarchicalLock

A lock that is similar to a ReadWriteLock except that it also provides a lock hierarchy. Acquiring a lock (in any mode) requires acquiring the lock's parent in shared (e.g. "read") mode. This is similar to locking constructs in RDBMSs, where you have related locks for a database, a table, and a record in a table.
